alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 23 at 6:28PM EST until December 24 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .A powerful storm which brought a broad swath of moderate to heavy rainfall to the region is lifting through northern New England with temperatures quickly crashing below freezing in its wake. While freezing temperatures will cease or slow overland runoff, runoff from rain and snowmelt through streams and waterways will continue through the next several hours into Saturday. The flash flooding threat has ended with heavy rainfall moving out of the area. The overland flooding threat has peaked, although low-lying and other poorly-drained areas make take several hours for waters to recede. Snowpack has absorbed much of the rain in the mountains, however much of the snowpack through the interior has melted off into local waterways which are currently seeing significant rises. Flashiest basins will peak tonight... while larger stems will see rises into tomorrow. Minor flooding is occuring on many of the smaller streams and rivers in the meantime. Cold temperatures on the backside of the storm system could cause flooded areas to freeze in place. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash, urban, and small stream flooding expected from widespread heavy rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin and Northern Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following area, Southern Coos. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Overland flooding could cause disruptions to travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A storm system has brought 1 to 3 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts in the higher terrain. Area snowpack has captured some of the rainfall to dampen the runoff, however sufficient runoff has occurred to cause rapid rises on small streams and creeks. Frozen ground and snow blocked drainage will exacerbate flooding conditions.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Travel in and out of the region could be disrupted due to flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
